Me, a spy? Of...course...not...
Asked him and turns out it was Afghanistan, not Syria. Anyway, he was there with some friends when they decided to take some pictures of some nice looking mountains. Then a load of cars rolled up full of men with ak47s who blindfolded them and took them to a compound where they were split up and interrogated for roughly five hours. Turns out that the mountains had in fact been the Khyber pass, which was a military area.
And if you want to know why he was there with some friends, he was on holiday. Such a boss.

My dad was arrested for spying in Syria.
Just saying...

Once when i was a child, i was attacked from behind a gorilla, i never saw him coming. I lived for ten years fearing that it would happen again. Then one day, a stranger told me, "to defeat fear, you must becone fear" and from that day onward, i vowed to become what i dreaded the most, to embrace my nightmares. That day, i became a stealthy gorilla...
